title: 79/295. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council

 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly

[without reference to a Main Committee (A/79/L.91)] 
 
 
 79/295. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Gulf 
Cooperation Council 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Recalling its previous resolutions on cooperation between the United Nations 
and regional and other organizations, particularly those highlighting the role of 
partnerships in maintaining international peace and security,  
 
Recalling also Article 52 of the Charter of the United Nations, which recognizes 
the existence of regional arrangements or agencies for dealing with such matters 
relating to the maintenance of international peace and security as are appropriate for 
regional action, provided that such arrangements or agencies and their activities are 
consistent with the purposes and principles of the United Nations,  
 
Recognizing Security Council resolutions 1631 (2005) of 17 October 2005 and 
2167 (2014) of 28 July 2014, which underscore the critical role of regional 
organizations in maintaining international peace and security, and the necessity of 
effective partnerships between the United Nations and such entities,  
 
Recalling the Charter of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf1 
(Gulf Cooperation Council), which emphasizes the importance of effective 
coordination, integration and interconnection among its member States in all fields,  
 
Underscoring the importance of the contributions of the Gulf Cooperation 
Council in understanding the root causes of conflicts within its region and in conflict 
prevention, resolution and peacebuilding efforts, 
 
Emphasizing the importance of a coordinated approach to peace and security, as 
highlighted in the report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations and conflict

prevention: a collective recommitment,2 which provides an overview of the efforts to 
strengthen United Nations prevention tools and initiatives, highlighting cooperation 
with regional and subregional organizations,  
 
Taking note of the report of the Secretary-General entitled “An Agenda for 
Peace”,3 particularly section VII concerning cooperation with regional organizations, 
as well as the reports of the Secretary-General entitled “Supplement to an Agenda for 
Peace”4 and “Our Common Agenda”,5 and the outcomes of the Summit of the Future, 
including the Pact for the Future,6 
 
Welcoming the convening of the Summit of the Future on 22–23 September 2024 
at the United Nations Headquarters in New York at which resolution 79/1 entitled 
“The Pact for the Future” and its annexes were adopted, in which the need to 
strengthen partnerships to address global challenges was reaffirmed,  
 
Considering the recommendations of the high-level meetings convened 
biennially by the Secretary-General with the heads of regional and subregional 
organizations,  
 
Recognizing the need to strengthen cooperation between the United Nations and 
the Gulf Cooperation Council with a view to achieving shared goals and objectives 
within the Charter of the United Nations in maintaining regional peace and security,  
 
Expressing its deep appreciation to the Secretary-General for his steadfast 
commitment and leadership in promoting partnerships for sustainable development, 
including addressing environmental challenges, and fostering regional cooperation in 
support of international peace and security,  
 
1. 
Welcomes the enhanced partnership between the United Nations and the 
Gulf Cooperation Council in the areas of conflict prevention and resolution and 
mediation;  
 
2. 
Emphasizes the importance of high-level consultations between the 
Secretary-General of the United Nations and the Secretary-General of the Gulf 
Cooperation Council, and encourages the continuation of annual strategic dialogue 
meetings;  
 
3. 
Requests the United Nations Secretariat, within existing resources and, 
where appropriate, through voluntary contributions: 
 
(a) 
To support capacity-building initiatives within the conflict prevention and 
resolution mechanisms of the Gulf Cooperation Council; 
 
(b) 
To provide technical assistance in developing early warning systems and 
preventive diplomacy capabilities; 
 
(c) 
To share best practices and expertise in preventive diplomacy, mediation 
and dialogue facilitation;  
 
4. 
Encourages the establishment of a joint working group, within existing 
resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary contributions, on regional peace 
and security: 
 
(a) 
To develop coordinated approaches to addressing regional emerging 
threats and challenges;

(b) 
To enhance information-sharing and analysis of regional developments; 
 
(c) 
To strengthen cooperation in preventive diplomacy and mediation efforts 
as well as post-conflict peacebuilding and reconciliation;  
 
5. 
Calls for the organization of regular expert-level meetings between the 
United Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council, within existing resources and, 
where appropriate, through voluntary contributions: 
 
(a) 
To exchange views on regional security developments; 
 
(b) 
To coordinate responses to regional common challenges; 
 
(c) 
To develop joint initiatives for conflict prevention and resolution;  
 
6. 
Requests relevant specialized United Nations agencies, programmes and 
institutions, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary 
contributions, in accordance with their mandates: 
 
(a) 
To strengthen their engagement with the Gulf Cooperation Council 
secretariat; 
 
(b) 
To provide technical support for capacity-building in conflict prevention 
and resolution; 
 
(c) 
To assist in developing regional mechanisms for crisis management;  
 
7. 
Encourages, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through 
voluntary contributions, the development of joint training programmes and 
workshops to enhance the institutional capacity of the Gulf Cooperation Council in: 
 
(a) 
Conflict analysis and early warning; 
 
(b) 
Preventive diplomacy and mediation; 
 
(c) 
Post-conflict peacebuilding and reconciliation;  
 
8. 
Requests the Secretary-General of the United Nations to submit to the 
General Assembly, at its eightieth session, a report on the implementation of the 
present resolution, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through 
voluntary contributions;  
 
9. 
Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under 
the item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and regional and other 
organizations”, a sub-item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and the 
Gulf Cooperation Council” and to consider the sub-item again at its eighty-first 
session and thereafter on a biennial basis.
